Re: License #: CO610385814
Dear Mary Jo French:
Attached is the Interim Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed on
June 13, 2024. The inspection has determined substantial compliance with applicable
licensing statutes and rules.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager, Jessica VandenHeuvel at 616-204-6992.
Sincerely,
Cathrine Raftery, Licensing Consultant

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The agency is in compliance with all applicable rules.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The agency was offered technical assistance in the following areas:
• There was no technical assistance requested or required.
2

V. CONSULTATION
The agency was offered consultation in the following areas:
• There was no consultation requested or required.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
Maltreatment in Care
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has submitted 1 acceptable corrective action plans (CAP) during this
licensing period, and compliance with each individual CAP is as follows:
Special Investigation 2023C0000744SI with CAP approval date of 10/05/23 was
result of a violation for a staff not demonstrating emotionally stability to perform his
assigned duties. This staff was put on adminastrative leave and underwent a fit for
duty assessment which provided the facility recommendations to support the staff
such as increased check-ins with direct supervisor. The facility additionally
implemented a personal assessment at the time of application for new hires which
helped with ongoing supervision support to staff based on their needs and learning
styles. The facility complied with all CAP action steps and DCWL continues to
monitor CAP compliance with no noted concerns.
Financial Overview
There are no financial concerns identified based on the review of the facility's
budget and the agency's financial audit.
PREA compliance (if applicable)
N/A
Chief Administrator Assessment
Not applicable
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported over the past year they feel their voice is being heard more by the
administration team and feel supported by direct line supervisors. They reported
they have enjoyed the additional programming that is to help support the youth in
3

learning life skills. Staff reported they are currently working on making sure there is
consistency for the youth throughout all shift changes. One staff suggested check
ins with shift leads to do "spot checks" about new policies/procedures that are
being put in place at the facility and quiz them on what they have learned. This was
shared with administration.
Three youth were interviewed during the inspection and reported feeling safe at the
facility. Two of the youth interviewed have been at the facility a couple of different
times and noted in the past year they have enjoyed the new incentive program that
has been in place. It was explained if the youth maintain on a higher level for
following expectations, they earn additional visits, phone calls, pizza, and other
privileges. The youth all reported having a safe staff at the facility that they can
report concerns to and noted they feel that administration takes their grievances
seriously. The main feedback from the youth was a request for consistency from
staff during shift change. This feedback was shared with administration.
Description of Agency Walk Through
An onsite inspection and walkthrough of the facility occurred on Jue 13, 2024.
There were no issues or safety concerns noted.
VII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is in compliance with all applicable licensing
statutes and rules. It is recommended that the agency continue on their regular license.
June 14, 2024
